intro: Monechma robustum, commonly known as the broadleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton. Monechma robustum is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
